basics.name: Hugo Queniat
basics.label: PhD Student in Statistics
basics.summary: I am a first-year PhD student in the Statistics CDT at the University of Warwick working under the joint supervision of Prof. Gareth Roberts and Dr Nick Tawn. My research interests lie in the area of Monte Carlo methods and probabilistic machine learning. Currently, I am working on tempering techniques to sample from multimodal target distributions. My work is part of the OCEAN research grant. Prior to joining the University of Warwick, I completed the MSc Mathematics Vision Learning organized by ENS Paris-Saclay and awarded by Institut Polytechnique de Paris. My Master's thesis, titled "On the Limits and Extensions of the Annealed Leap-Point Sampler", was completed here in Warwick and supervised by Prof. Gareth Roberts. It focused on the Annealed Leap-Point Sampler, studying its applicability to the sampling from distributions exhibiting non smooth and/or non regular modes. At the same time, I completed the MSc in Engineering from Télécom Paris.

projects.name: Master’s Thesis — On the Limits and Extensions of the Annealed Leap-Point Sampler
projects.description: Refined theoretical limits and practical extensions of ALPS for non-smooth target distributions; co-authored a manuscript submitted to Statistics and Computing.

projects.name: Challenges in Markov Chain Monte Carlo for Bayesian Neural Networks
projects.description: Implemented MCMC methods (MH, MALA, HMC, Tempering) and compared performance on datasets including Noisy XOR, Penguins, and Iris.

projects.name: Incorporating Deep Generative Priors in Plug-and-Play Gibbs Sampler
projects.description: Integrated stochastic denoisers within a PnP Gibbs framework; ran simulations for image inpainting tasks.

projects.name: SNCF-ENS Data Challenge — Forecast Attendance in Transilien Stations
projects.description: Built forecasting dataset for 440 stations (2015–2022) with calendar features, COVID indicators, outlier handling, and log-target transforms; trained GBT (XGBoost) with asymmetric objective and station-specific models.

projects.name: ALTeGraD 2023 — Molecule Retrieval from Natural-Language Queries
projects.description: Contrastive text-graph pipeline (DistilBERT + GAT/Transformer variants) with full reproducibility; soft-voting ensemble across runs.

projects.name: Multi-task Gaussian Processes for Time-Series Forecasting (MAGMA)
projects.description: Implemented MAGMA with EM-based parameter estimation; compared against GP baselines on synthetic and real time-series.
